details.formulaStrippedArticleTitle: Foundation for mitigating range dependence in radar space-time adaptive processing
details.title: Foundation for mitigating range dependence in radar space-time adaptive processing
details.standardTitle: Foundation for mitigating range dependence in radar space-time adaptive processing
details.abstract: The problem of detecting slow-moving targets using a space-time adaptive processing (STAP) radar is addressed. The determination of the optimum interference-rejection weights at each range is based on snapshots at neighbouring ranges. However, in virtually all bistatic configurations or/and when using conformal antenna arrays (CAA), snapshot statistics are range dependent, which results in poor detection performance. To address this issue, a foundation for range-dependence compensation in STAP in the case of Gaussian interference and noise is proposed. The realistic case where received snapshots are the only source of information for mitigating the range dependence is considered. To illustrate the usefulness of the proposed foundation, this foundation is used to design a method to adaptively compensate for range dependence in a challenging situation, that is, for a radar using a CAA and operating in a bistatic configuration.

ieee.displayText: Jingwei Xu, Shengqi Zhu, Guisheng Liao, "Range Ambiguous Clutter Suppression for Airborne FDA-STAP Radar", Selected Topics in Signal Processing IEEE Journal of, vol. 9, pp. 1620-1631, 2015, ISSN 1932-4553.
ieee.title: Range Ambiguous Clutter Suppression for Airborne FDA-STAP Radar

ieee.title: Space-time adaptive processing based on Beam-Doppler shift for bistatic radar
